00056 
00057 //Using the ESC key in the PBI will get rid of the PBI and go back to mapscreen, but 
00058 //only if the PBI isn't persistant (!gfPersistantPBI).
00059 extern BOOLEAN gfPersistantPBI;
00060 
00061 //Contains general information about the type of encounter the player is faced with.  This
00062 //determines whether or not you can autoresolve the battle or even retreat.  This code
00063 //dictates the header that is used at the top of the PBI.
00064 extern UINT8 gubEnemyEncounterCode;
00065 
00066 //The autoresolve during tactical battle option needs more detailed information than the 
00067 //gubEnemyEncounterCode can provide.  The explicit version contains possibly unique codes
00068 //for reasons not normally used in the PBI.  For example, if we were fighting the enemy
00069 //in a normal situation, then shot at a civilian, the civilians associated with the victim
00070 //would turn hostile, which would disable the ability to autoresolve the battle.
00071 extern BOOLEAN gubExplicitEnemyEncounterCode;
00072 
00073 //Location of the current battle (determines where the animated icon is blitted) and if the
00074 //icon is to be blitted.
00075 extern BOOLEAN gfBlitBattleSectorLocator;
